main event: A UFO was observed on radar and visually by a ground observer in Warner Robins, Georgia in July 1957.
interesting points: The object appeared as a star-sized white or silver object that made erratic movements, including a sudden sharp right turn and disappearing beyond the horizon.
The object was observed for about 5 minutes on radar, with the radar and visual observations in conflict.
The observer was unable to estimate the altitude or speed of the object.
The weather conditions at the time were clear, with light winds.
An A-57 aircraft was in the area during the sighting, but the pilot only saw two planets, not the reported UFO.
sighted object: one star-sized white or silver object
